definition[0]: to organize something in a new way
example[0]: The College Board has retooled the admission exams.
definition[1]: to change or replace the machines or tools in a factory
definition[2]: to change or replace the production equipment used in a factory
example[1]: It will spend $300 million retooling a plant to produce televisions.
example[2]: The company plans to shut two plants for a month to retool for the redesigned minivans.
definition[3]: to change the way in which something is done
example[3]: Two big auction houses areretooling their salesstrategies in hopes of succeeding in a difficult market.
